fields.value: Massachusetts Archives Collection. v.236-Revolution Resolves, 1782. SC1/series 45X, Petition of John Winthrop

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Support for individuals

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:13909138

Date of creation: 17820000

Petition location: Boston

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Several names from a committee

Selected signatures:

  1. John Winthrop

Actions taken on dates: 1782-05-03,1782-05-04

Legislative action: Received in the House on May 3, 1782 and resolved and granted and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on May 4, 1782 and read and concurred

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, resolved, granted, sent, received, read, concurred

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional archivist notes: South Carolina, number of negroes, Hazard, Tyrannicide, accounts, Caleb Davis, Board of War, Harvard University, ["…but they all at length being weary of Controul & finding that they could not be detained by Law, liberated themselves…"]

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 236, pages 245-247

Acknowledgements: Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities (PW-5105612), Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth, Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study at Harvard University, Center for American Political Studies at Harvard University, Institutional Development Initiative at Harvard University, and Harvard University Library.
